distroi.geom_comp module

Defines the classes and methods needed for geometric components which can be addded to RT models in OI observable calculations. A geometric component also optionally includes a spectral profile to describe its flux dependence accross wavelength.

class distroi.geom_comp.BlackBodySpecDep(temp)

Bases: distroi.geom_comp.SpecDep

Blackbody spectral flux dependency.

Parameters

temp (float) – The blackbody temperature in Kelvin.

Variables

temp (float) – See parameter description.

flux_from_ref(x: numpy.ndarray | float, x_ref: float, ref_flux: float, flux_form: str = 'flam') → numpy.ndarray | float

Retrieve the flux at certain wavelengths/frequencies when given a reference flux value and wavelength/frequency.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray | float) – Wavelengths/frequencies (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux.

  • x_ref (np.ndarray | float) – Reference wavelength/frequency (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x_ref is assumed to be a wavelength, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x_ref is assumed to be a frequency.

  • ref_flux (float) – Reference flux from which to calculate the flux, in the specified ‘flux_form’ format.

  • flux_form (str) – The format of the flux to be calculated. Options are ‘flam’ (default) and ‘lam_flam’, as well as their frequency analogues ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x is assumed to be wavelengths, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x is assumed to be frequencies.

Return flux

The flux calculated at x using the reference wavelength/frequency and reference flux value. Note that the units of both input and output will correspond to those of x_ref and ref_flux.

Return type

np.ndarray | float

class distroi.geom_comp.FlatSpecDep(flux_form='flam')

Bases: distroi.geom_comp.SpecDep

Flat spectral dependence.

Parameters

flux_form (str) – The format of the flux which follows the flat dependency. Options are ‘flam’ (default) and ‘lam_flam’, as well as their frequency analogues ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’. The formats in wavelength specification (‘flam’ and ‘lam_flam’) assume the power law dependency to be in wavelength (i.e. flux1 / flux2 = (wavelength1 / wavelength2) ^ power), while the ones in frequency specification assume the power law to be in frequency (i.e. flux1 / flux2 = (frequency1 / frequency2) ^ power). Note that a flat law in ‘flam’ in wavelength will result in a power law for ‘fnu’ in frequency of power ‘-2’, i.e. the transformation between ‘fnu’ and ‘flam’ matters.

flux_from_ref(x: numpy.ndarray | float, x_ref: float, ref_flux: float, flux_form: str = 'flam') → numpy.ndarray | float

Retrieve the flux at certain wavelengths/frequencies when given a reference flux value and wavelength/frequency.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray | float) – Wavelengths/frequencies (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux.

  • x_ref (np.ndarray | float) – Reference wavelength/frequency (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x_ref is assumed to be a wavelength, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x_ref is assumed to be a frequency.

  • ref_flux (float) – Reference flux from which to calculate the flux, in the specified ‘flux_form’ format.

  • flux_form (str) – The format of the flux to be calculated. Options are ‘flam’ (default) and ‘lam_flam’, as well as their frequency analogues ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x is assumed to be wavelengths, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x is assumed to be frequencies.

Return flux

The flux calculated at x using the reference wavelength/frequency and reference flux value. Note that the units of both input and output will correspond to those of x_ref and ref_flux.

Return type

np.ndarray | float

class distroi.geom_comp.Gaussian(fwhm: float, coords: Optional[tuple[float, float]] = None, spec_dep: Optional[distroi.geom_comp.SpecDep] = None)

Bases: distroi.geom_comp.GeomComp

Class representing a Gaussian geomteric component:

Parameters

  • fwhm (float) – Full-width-half-maximum of the Gaussian in the image plane (in mas units).

  • coords (tuple(float)) – 2D tuples with (x, y) coordinates of the point’s coordinates (in mas). Note that positive x is defined as leftward and positive y as upward (i.e. the East and North repesctively in the OI convention). If not given, will default to (0, 0).

  • spec_dep (SpecDep) – Optional spectral dependence of the component. If None, the spectral dependency will be assumed flat in correlated flux accross wavelength (note that flatness in correlated flux means a spectral dependency ~ wavelength ^ -2 for F_lam).

Variables

  • fwhm (float) – See parameter description.

  • coords (tuple(float)) – See parameter description.

  • spec_dep (SpecDep) – See parameter description.

calc_vis(uf: numpy.ndarray | float, vf: numpy.ndarray | float, wavelength: Optional[Union[numpy.ndarray, float]] = None, ref_wavelength: Optional[float] = None, ref_corr_flux: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray | float

Calculate the visibility at given spatial frequencies. Wavelengths corresponding to these spatial frequencies a and a reference flux value (at reference wavelength) can also be passed along, in which case the returned visibilities will be in correlated flux (Jy) instead of normalized.

Parameters

  • uf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial x-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as uf.

  • vf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial y-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as vf.

  • wavelength (np.ndarray) – 1D array with wavelength values in micron.

  • ref_wavelength (float) – Reference wavelength in micron.

  • ref_corr_flux (float) – Reference correlated flux in Jy corresponding to ref_wavelength. If provided together with ref_corr_flux, then the returned visibilities are in correlated flux.

Return vis

1D array with the calculated visibilities (normalized or in corrleated flux, depending on the optional arguments)

Return type

np.ndarray

class distroi.geom_comp.GeomComp

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class representing a geometric model component.

Variables

spec_dep (SpecDep | None) – Optional spectral dependence of the component. If None, the spectral dependency will be assumed flat in correlated flux accross wavelength (note that flatness in correlated flux means a spectral dependency ~ wavelength ^ -2 for F_lam).

abstract calc_vis(uf: numpy.ndarray | float, vf: numpy.ndarray | float, wavelength: Optional[Union[numpy.ndarray, float]] = None, ref_wavelength: Optional[float] = None, ref_corr_flux: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray | float

Calculate the visibility of the geometric component at given spatial frequencies. Wavelengths corresponding to these spatial frequencies and a reference total flux (at reference wavelength) can also be passed along, in which case the returned visibilities will be in correlated flux (Jy) instead of normalized.

Parameters

  • uf (np.ndarray | float) – 1D array with spatial x-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as uf.

  • vf (np.ndarray | float) – 1D array with spatial y-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as vf.

  • wavelength (np.ndarray | float) – 1D array with wavelength values in micron.

  • ref_wavelength (float | None) – Reference wavelength in micron.

  • ref_corr_flux (float | None) – Reference correlated flux in Jy corresponding to ref_wavelength. If provided together with ref_corr_flux, then the returned visibilities are in correlated flux.

Return vis

1D array with the calculated visibilities (normalized or in corrleated flux, depending on the optional arguments)

Return type

np.ndarray | float

calc_vis(uf: numpy.ndarray | float, vf: numpy.ndarray | float, wavelength: Optional[Union[numpy.ndarray, float]] = None, ref_wavelength: Optional[float] = None, ref_corr_flux: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray | float

Calculate the visibility at given spatial frequencies. Wavelengths corresponding to these spatial frequencies a and a reference flux value (at reference wavelength) can also be passed along, in which case the returned visibilities will be in correlated flux (Jy) instead of normalized.

Parameters

  • uf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial x-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as uf.

  • vf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial y-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as vf.

  • wavelength (np.ndarray) – 1D array with wavelength values in micron.

  • ref_wavelength (float) – Reference wavelength in micron.

  • ref_corr_flux (float) – Reference correlated flux in Jy corresponding to ref_wavelength. If provided together with ref_corr_flux, then the returned visibilities are in correlated flux.

Return vis

Return type

class distroi.geom_comp.PowerLawSpecDep(power, flux_form='flam')

Bases: distroi.geom_comp.SpecDep

Power law flux dependency.

Parameters

  • power (float) – The power of the flux profile.

  • flux_form (str) – The format of the flux to be calculated. This flux will follow the specified power law dependency. Options are ‘flam’ (default) and ‘lam_flam’, as well as their frequency analogues ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’. The formats in wavelength specification (‘flam’ and ‘lam_flam’) assume the power law dependency to be in wavelength (i.e. flux1 / flux2 = (wavelength1 / wavelength2) ^ power), while the ones in frequency specification assume the power law to be in frequency (i.e. flux1 / flux2 = (frequency1 / frequency2) ^ power). Note that a power law of ‘flam’ of power ‘d’ in wavelength will result in a power law for ‘fnu’ in frequency of power ‘-d-2’, i.e. the transformation between ‘fnu’ and ‘flam’ matters.

Variables

power (float) – See parameter description.

flux_from_ref(x: numpy.ndarray | float, x_ref: float, ref_flux: float, flux_form: str = 'flam') → numpy.ndarray | float

Retrieve the flux at certain wavelengths/frequencies when given a reference flux value and wavelength/frequency.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray | float) – Wavelengths/frequencies (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux.

  • x_ref (np.ndarray | float) – Reference wavelength/frequency (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x_ref is assumed to be a wavelength, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x_ref is assumed to be a frequency.

  • ref_flux (float) – Reference flux from which to calculate the flux, in the specified ‘flux_form’ format.

  • flux_form (str) – The format of the flux to be calculated. Options are ‘flam’ (default) and ‘lam_flam’, as well as their frequency analogues ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x is assumed to be wavelengths, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x is assumed to be frequencies.

Return flux

The flux calculated at x using the reference wavelength/frequency and reference flux value. Note that the units of both input and output will correspond to those of x_ref and ref_flux.

Return type

np.ndarray | float

class distroi.geom_comp.SpecDep

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class representing a spectral dependence to be attached to a geometric model component. Note that these do not represent full-fledged spectra. These are not absolute-flux calibrated, and only represent the dependence of flux on wavelength/frequency. A flux at a reference wavelength/frequency (derived from e.g. geometrical modelling) must be passed along in order to get absolute values.

abstract flux_from_ref(x: numpy.ndarray | float, x_ref: float, ref_flux: float, flux_form: str = 'flam') → numpy.ndarray | float

Retrieve the flux at certain wavelengths/frequencies when given a reference flux value and wavelength/frequency.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray | float) – Wavelengths/frequencies (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux.

  • x_ref (np.ndarray | float) – Reference wavelength/frequency (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x_ref is assumed to be a wavelength, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x_ref is assumed to be a frequency.

  • ref_flux (float) – Reference flux from which to calculate the flux, in the specified ‘flux_form’ format.

  • flux_form (str) – The format of the flux to be calculated. Options are ‘flam’ (default) and ‘lam_flam’, as well as their frequency analogues ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x is assumed to be wavelengths, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x is assumed to be frequencies.

Return flux

The flux calculated at x using the reference wavelength/frequency and reference flux value. Note that the units of both input and output will correspond to those of x_ref and ref_flux.

Return type

np.ndarray | float

class distroi.geom_comp.ThinAccDiskSpecDep(acc_rate: float, star_mass: float, r_in: float, r_out: float, eta_rad: float)

Bases: distroi.geom_comp.SpecDep

Spectral dependency of a thin, multi-blackbody accretion disk, as specified in De Prins et al. 2024. The disk has a blackbody temperature gradient derived assuming a certain accretion rate and radiative efficiency, the latter denoting the fraction of released gravitational power which is converted to radiation.

Parameters

  • acc_rate (float) – Accretion rate at the inner disk rim in units of M_sun yr^-1.

  • star_mass (float) – Mass of the star at the centre of the disk in M_sun.

  • r_in (float) – Inner disk rim radius in Solar radii.

  • r_out (float) – Outer disk rim radius in Solar radii.

  • eta_rad (float) – Radiative efficiency, expressed as a fraction between 0 and 1

flux_from_ref(x: numpy.ndarray | float, x_ref: float, ref_flux: float, flux_form: str = 'flam') → numpy.ndarray | float

Retrieve the flux at certain wavelengths/frequencies when given a reference flux value and wavelength/frequency.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray | float) – Wavelengths/frequencies (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux.

  • x_ref (np.ndarray | float) – Reference wavelength/frequency (in micron/Hz) at which to calculate the flux. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x_ref is assumed to be a wavelength, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x_ref is assumed to be a frequency.

  • ref_flux (float) – Reference flux from which to calculate the flux, in the specified ‘flux_form’ format.

  • flux_form (str) – The format of the flux to be calculated. Options are ‘flam’ (default) and ‘lam_flam’, as well as their frequency analogues ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’. In case flux_form = ‘flam’ or ‘lam_flam’, x is assumed to be wavelengths, while in case of ‘fnu’ and ‘nu_fnu’, x is assumed to be frequencies.

Return flux

The flux calculated at x using the reference wavelength/frequency and reference flux value. Note that the units of both input and output will correspond to those of x_ref and ref_flux.

Return type

np.ndarray | float

class distroi.geom_comp.UniformDisk(diameter: float, coords: Optional[tuple[float, float]] = None, spec_dep: Optional[distroi.geom_comp.SpecDep] = None)

Bases: distroi.geom_comp.GeomComp

Class representing a uniform disk geometric component.

Parameters

  • diameter (float) – The radius of the disk in milli-arcsecond.

  • coords (tuple(float)) – 2D tuples with (x, y) coordinates of the disk center’s coordinates (in mas). Note that positive x is defined as leftward and positive y as upward (i.e. the East and North repesctively in the OI convention). If not given, will default to (0, 0).

  • spec_dep (SpecDep) – Optional spectral dependence of the component. If None, the spectral dependency will be assumed flat in correlated flux accross wavelength (note that flatness in correlated flux means a spectral dependency ~ wavelength ^ -2 for F_lam).

Variables

  • radius (float) – See parameter description.

  • coords (tuple(float)) – See parameter description.

  • spec_dep (SpecDep) – See parameter description.

calc_vis(uf: numpy.ndarray | float, vf: numpy.ndarray | float, wavelength: Optional[Union[numpy.ndarray, float]] = None, ref_wavelength: Optional[float] = None, ref_corr_flux: Optional[float] = None) → numpy.ndarray | float

Calculate the visibility at given spatial frequencies. Wavelengths corresponding to these spatial frequencies a and a reference flux value (at reference wavelength) can also be passed along, in which case the returned visibilities will be in correlated flux (Jy) instead of normalized.

Parameters

  • uf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial x-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as uf.

  • vf (np.ndarray) – 1D array with spatial y-axis frequencies in 1/radian. Must be the same size as vf.

  • wavelength (np.ndarray) – 1D array with wavelength values in micron.

  • ref_wavelength (float) – Reference wavelength in micron.

  • ref_corr_flux (float) – Reference correlated flux in Jy corresponding to ref_wavelength. If provided together with ref_corr_flux, then the returned visibilities are in correlated flux.

Return vis

1D array with the calculated visibilities (normalized or in corrleated flux, depending on the optional arguments)

Return type

np.ndarray
